column4: Is there any other graphical utility to handle which services load on boot other than the one that comes with GNOME?  The GNOME "service-admin" only lists a fraction of the services on the system.
And I prefer not to use Webmin, if possible.
if you don't mind using the command line try this article: http://linuxhelp.blogspot.com/2006/04/enabling-and-disabling-services-during_01.html
note you will need to use sudo in front of those commands
